name: Uproot
text: Put target land on top of its owner's library.

editions.flavor:
"We arrived at the battlefield too late. Again. Another error on your part, and you will have to answer to me personally."
—General Takeno, letter to the imperial mapmaker

name: Upwelling
text: Mana pools don't empty as steps and phases end.

editions.flavor: Once again, Kamahl felt the full force of the Mirari's pull, but he had learned much since the last time.
Freyalise promised a dawn that would never end, a day of limitless life. As many dread her promise as revere it.

name: Urabrask the Hidden
text:
Creatures you control have haste.
Creatures your opponents control enter the battlefield tapped.

editions.flavor: When the Mirran resistance arrived, the furnace dwellers looked to Urabrask for guidance. His decree stunned the others: "Let them be."

name: Urban Burgeoning
text:
Enchant land
Enchanted land has "Untap this land during each other player's untap step."

editions.flavor: The ruins of Old Prahv became a wildspace, although all birdsong was silenced by lingering Azorius magic.

name: Urban Evolution
text: Draw three cards. You may play an additional land this turn.

editions.flavor: As the Simic released more of their krasis experiments, they required new habitats, always at the expense of the locals.
As the Simic released more of their krasis experiments, they required new habitats, always at the expense of the locals.

name: Urbis Protector
text: When Urbis Protector enters the battlefield, create a 4/4 white Angel creature token with flying.

editions.flavor:
"I hear that Boros is losing its angels to the Gateless Movement. I'm sure this comes as no surprise to you."
—Teysa, to Lazav

name: Urborg
text:
{T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.
{T}: Target creature loses first strike or swampwalk until end of turn.

editions.flavor:
"Resignedly beneath the sky/The melancholy waters lie./So blend the turrets and shadows there/That all seem pendulous in air,/While from a proud tower in town/Death looks gigantically down."
—Edgar Allan Poe, "The City in the Sea"

"Resignedly beneath the sky/The melancholy waters lie./So blend the turrets and shadows there/That all seem pendulous in air,/While from a proud tower in town/Death looks gigantically down." —Edgar Allan Poe, "The City in the Sea"

name: Urborg Drake
text:
Flying
Urborg Drake attacks each turn if able.

editions.flavor: Relentless as the sea, remorseless as death.

name: Urborg Elf
text: {T}: Add {G}, {U}, or {B} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: The elves of Urborg are as deadly and capricious as the swamp itself.

name: Urborg Emissary
text:
Kicker {1}{U} (You may pay an additional {1}{U} as you cast this spell.)
When Urborg Emissary enters the battlefield, if it was kicked, return target permanent to its owner's hand.

name: Urborg Justice
text: Target opponent sacrifices a creature for each creature put into your graveyard from the battlefield this turn.

editions.flavor:
"It is a narrow line between justice and vengeance."
—Crovax

name: Urborg Mindsucker
text: {B}, Sacrifice Urborg Mindsucker: Target opponent discards a card at random. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

editions.flavor:
"My pet will pick the ripe fruit from your tortured brain as if it were hanging from a vine."
—Kaervek

"My pet will pick the ripe fruit from your tortured brain as if it were hanging from a vine."
—Kaervek

name: Urborg Panther
text:
{B}, Sacrifice Urborg Panther: Destroy target creature blocking Urborg Panther.
Sacrifice a creature named Feral Shadow, a creature named Breathstealer, and Urborg Panther: Search your library for a card named Spirit of the Night and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

name: Urborg Phantom
text:
Urborg Phantom can't block.
{U}: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by Urborg Phantom this turn.

editions.flavor: A chilling fog with teeth of ice.

name: Urborg Shambler
text: Other black creatures get -1/-1.

editions.flavor: A writhing mass of rot, with sharp claws and a vicious spirit.

name: Urborg Skeleton
text:
Kicker {3} (You may pay an additional {3} as you cast this spell.)
{B}: Regenerate Urborg Skeleton.
If Urborg Skeleton was kicked, it enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it.

name: Urborg Stalker
text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, if that player controls a nonblack, nonland permanent, Urborg Stalker deals 1 damage to that player.

editions.flavor:
"May you be a stalker's dream."
—Urborg curse

name: Urborg Syphon-Mage
text: {2}{B}, {T}, Discard a card: Each other player loses 2 life. You gain life equal to the life lost this way.

editions.set: Duel Decks Anthology, Garruk vs. Liliana
editions.flavor: "I have become a gourmet of sorts. Each soul has its own distinctive flavor. The art is in inviting the right company to the feast."
"I have become a gourmet of sorts. Each soul has its own distinctive flavor. The art is in inviting the right company to the feast."
"I have become a gourmet of sorts. Each soul has its own distinctive flavor. The art is in inviting the right company to the feast."
"I have become a gourmet of sorts. Each soul has its own distinctive flavor. The art is in inviting the right company to the feast."

name: Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth
text: Each land is a Swamp in addition to its other land types.

editions.flavor:
"Yawgmoth's corpse is a wound in the universe. His foul blood seeps out, infecting the land with his final curse."
—Lord Windgrace

"Yawgmoth's corpse is a wound in the universe. His foul blood seeps out, infecting the land with his final curse."
—Lord Windgrace

"Yawgmoth's corpse is a wound in the universe. His foul blood seeps out, infecting the land with his final curse."
—Lord Windgrace

name: Urborg Uprising
text:
Return up to two target creature cards from your graveyard to your hand.
Draw a card.

editions.flavor: In Urborg, few things are less permanent than death.
In Urborg, few things are less permanent than death.
In Urborg, few things are less permanent than death.

name: Urborg Volcano
text:
Urborg Volcano enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {B} or {R} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: Deep in the heart of Urborg lie massive volcanoes whose thick black smoke covers the land with perpetual darkness.
Deep in the heart of Urborg lie massive volcanoes whose thick black smoke covers the land with perpetual darkness.

name: Ur-Drago
text:
First strike
Creatures with swampwalk can be blocked as though they didn't have swampwalk.

name: Urgent Exorcism
text: Destroy target Spirit or enchantment.

editions.flavor:
"To show geists pity is to prolong their agonies. Whether they know it or not, they seek the Blessed Sleep, and we are to give it to them."
—Mikaeus, the Lunarch

name: Urge to Feed
text: Target creature gets -3/-3 until end of turn. You may tap any number of untapped Vampire creatures you control. If you do, put a +1/+1 counter on each of those Vampires.

name: Ur-Golem's Eye
text: {T}: Add {C}{C} to your mana pool.

editions.flavor: It still stares accusingly at Memnarch, though millennia have passed since he separated the eye from its body.
Ur-golems once dominated the plane. Even now, they maintain a deep connection to it.
It still stares accusingly at Memnarch, though millennia have passed since he separated the eye from its body.

name: Uril, the Miststalker
text:
Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
Uril, the Miststalker gets +2/+2 for each Aura attached to it.

editions.flavor: It strides through the whitecover, mists in which even gargantuans can hide.

name: Ursapine
text: {G}: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

editions.flavor: A friendly ursapine means a constant supply of sharp spears. An unfriendly one means a constant supply of small holes.

name: Ursine Fylgja
text:
Ursine Fylgja enters the battlefield with four healing counters on it.
Remove a healing counter from Ursine Fylgja: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to Ursine Fylgja this turn.
{2}{W}: Put a healing counter on Ursine Fylgja.

name: Urza
text: {3}: Urza deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

editions.flavor: An artificer of unparalleled renown, Urza was a powerful cipher even before he was able to planeswalk. Seeing the world as a large, integrated machine is his greatest strength and weakness, enabling him to solve almost any problem but blinding him to his solutions' effects on others.

name: Urza's Armor
text: If a source would deal damage to you, prevent 1 of that damage.

editions.flavor: Urza protected his body well, but neglected his soul.

"Tawnos's blueprints were critical to the creation of my armor. As he once sealed himself in steel, I sealed myself in a walking crypt."
—Urza

name: Urza's Avenger
text: {0}: Urza's Avenger gets -1/-1 and gains your choice of banding, flying, first strike, or trample until end of turn. (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)

editions.flavor: Unable to settle on just one design, Urza decided to create one versatile being.
Unable to settle on just one design, Urza decided to create one versatile being.
Unable to settle on just one design, Urza decided to create one versatile being.

name: Urza's Bauble
text: {T}, Sacrifice Urza's Bauble: Look at a card at random in target player's hand. You draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.

name: Urza's Blueprints
text:
Echo {6} (At the beginning of your upkeep, if this came under your control since the beginning of your last upkeep, sacrifice it unless you pay its echo cost.)
{T}: Draw a card.

editions.flavor: From concept to paper to reality.

name: Urza's Chalice
text: Whenever a player casts an artifact spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

editions.flavor: When sorely wounded or tired, Urza would often retreat to the workshops of his apprentices. They were greatly amazed at how much better he looked each time he took a sip of water.
When sorely wounded or tired, Urza would often retreat to the workshops of his apprentices. They were greatly amazed at how much better he looked each time he took a sip of water.

name: Urza's Contact Lenses
text:
Urza's Contact Lenses comes into play tapped and does not untap during its controller's untap phase.
All players play with their hands face up.
Clap your hands twice: Tap or untap Urza's Contact Lenses.

name: Urza's Engine
text:
Trample
{3}: Urza's Engine gains banding until end of turn. (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
{3}: Attacking creatures banded with Urza's Engine gain trample until end of turn.

editions.flavor: "Humans and machines working together can be fearsome indeed!" —Arcum Dagsson

name: Urza's Factory
text:
{T}: Add {C} to your mana pool.
{7}, {T}: Create a 2/2 colorless Assembly-Worker artifact creature token.

editions.flavor:
"Though their ideals are leagues apart, Urza's and Mishra's creations have a surprising harmony with one another."
—Tocasia, journal entry

—Tocasia, journal entry

name: Urza's Filter
text: Multicolored spells cost up to {2} less to cast.

editions.flavor: "It's a tool for aiding my other tools," explained Urza. "Now they'll work in harmony."

name: Urza's Guilt
text: Each player draws two cards, then discards three cards, then loses 4 life.

editions.flavor: Deep in Yawgmoth's realm, Urza stopped dead in his tracks and rubbed his soot-filled eyes. "Mishra?"

name: Urza's Hot Tub
text: {2}, Discard a card: Search your library for a card that shares a complete word in its name with the discarded card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

editions.flavor: www.wizards.com/hottub

Creature spells of the chosen type cost {2} less to cast.

text: Whenever Valakut Fireboar attacks, switch its power and toughness until end of turn.

editions.flavor:

—Chadir the Navigator

editions.flavor: "As long as we have walked this world, we have known it as a harsh and unforgiving place."—The Invokers' Tales

name: Valeron Outlander
text: Protection from black

editions.flavor: After years of honing her philosophy in debate with stubborn rhoxes, Niella was ready to convert any heathen.

name: Valeron Wardens
text:
Renown 2 (When this creature deals combat damage to a player, if it isn't renowned, put two +1/+1 counters on it and it becomes renowned.)
Whenever a creature you control becomes renowned, draw a card.

editions.flavor: As the outsiders invaded Bant, soldiers who once saw sigils as the highest marks of glory began to see the scars of battle as tokens of equal worth.

Haste
Valley Dasher attacks each turn if able.

editions.flavor: Mardu riders' greatest fear is that a battle might end before their weapons draw blood.

name: Vampire Outcasts

name: Vampire's Bite
text:
Kicker {2}{B} (You may pay an additional {2}{B} as you cast this spell.)
Target creature gets +3/+0 until end of turn. If Vampire's Bite was kicked, that creature gains lifelink until end of turn. (Damage dealt by the creature also causes its controller to gain that much life.)

name: Vampire Warlord
text: Sacrifice another creature: Regenerate Vampire Warlord. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

text:
Flying

name: Vampiric Embrace
text:

name: Vampiric Feast
text: Vampiric Feast deals 4 damage to target creature or player and you gain 4 life.

name: Vampiric Fury

editions.flavor: Many peasants secretly admire vampires' glamour and elegance—until they witness a moment of pure bloodlust.

name: Vampiric Link
text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage, you gain that much life.

editions.flavor: The familiar's fangs deliver the master's bite.

name: Vampiric Rites
text: {1}{B}, Sacrifice a creature: You gain 1 life and draw a card.

editions.flavor: For vampires, blood carries more than life. Memories long eroded from the minds of bloodchiefs can be reclaimed from the veins of their sired kin.

name: Vampiric Sliver
text: All Sliver creatures have "Whenever a creature dealt damage by this creature this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature."

editions.flavor: They draw upon the strength of their hive and of their victims.

name: Vampiric Spirit
text:
Flying

name: Vampiric Touch
text: Vampiric Touch deals 2 damage to target opponent and you gain 2 life.

editions.flavor: A touch, not comforting, but of death.

name: Vampiric Tutor
text: Search your library for a card, then shuffle your library and put that card on top of it. You lose 2 life.
